articles.title: Christians in Korea Demand Nullification of Revised "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines"
articles.content:
Christians in Korea Demand Nullification of Revised "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines" 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Christian Federation of Korea and the National Council of Christian Churches in south Korea issued a joint statement on Monday denouncing the U.S. and Japan for threatening peace on the Korean peninsula, in East Asia and the rest of the world.
					 U.S. President Obama and Japanese Prime Minister Abe held talks at the White House on April 29 at which they agreed to revise the "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines", which consider the whole world including the Korean peninsula as the operation sphere of the Japan's "Self-Defence Forces". 
					
					 At the talks the U.S. decided to support even the bid of Japan, war criminal state, for permanent membership of the UNSC.
					
					 The statement dismissed the decision as an insult to the Korean people who had suffered under the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 If the U.S. allows Japan to land on the peninsula in contingency, pursuant to the guidelines, the peaceful reunification of the peninsula will be more difficult and extreme uneasiness will prevail in the north and the south, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The closer U.S.-Japan cooperation in defence would scrap Japan's policy of exclusive defence and, consequently, spark off hot arms race in East Asia including the peninsula and result in escalating military tension in the region and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The statement clarified the following stands:
					
					 First. The agreement on revising the "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines" should be nullified at once as it threatens the peace on the Korean peninsula, Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Second. The U.S. government should abandon its ambition for military supremacy and make a switchover to peace-loving diplomacy for dialogue and cooperation.
					
					 Third. The Japanese government should apologize to the world for its war crimes, abide by the Pacifist Constitution and stop pursuing its ambition to emerge a military giant. 
					
					 Fourth. The Christians in the north and the south will pray and take action in solidarity with world churches and conscience of the whole world aspiring after peace so as to preserve peace on the peninsula, in East Asia and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas Koreans Monday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio. They included a delegation of the General Union of Syrian Peasants and a delegation of the Osaka Branch of the Korean Scientists and Technologists Association in Japan.
					 They laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Syrian Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Syrian Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Union of Syrian Peasants led by Chairman Hammad Abboud Al Saud arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Polish Embassy Officials Help Farmers of DPRK
articles.content:
Polish Embassy Officials Help Farmers of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Krzysztof Ciebien, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials did friendship labor at the DPRK-Poland Friendship Jangsuwon Cooperative Farm on Monday.
					 They helped farmers in weeding vegetable fields.
					
					 During a break they enjoyed an art performance given by kindergartners and talked to officials of the farm.
					
					 The staff members handed over aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: DPRK Weightlifter Proves Successful at World Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifter Proves Successful at World Championship
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK weightlifter Pak Jong Ju bagged three gold medals at the 2015 World Youth Weightlifting Championship.
					 He lifted 124 kg in snatch and 156 kg in jerk at the men's 62 kg category events.
					
					 Another DPRK weightlifter Ri Song Gum won bronze medals at the women's 48 kg category events.

articles.title: Kigwancha Sports Team Proves Successful in National Weightlifting Contests
articles.content:
Kigwancha Sports Team Proves Successful in National Weightlifting Contests
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Kigwancha Sports Team of the DPRK showed good results in weightlifting event of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games held in Pyongyang recently.
					The team won 19 gold medals out of the 45 in 15 categories.
					
					 In particular, it bagged all gold medals in men's 69 kg and women's 63kg, 69kg and 75kg categories.
					
					 In the past the team produced a number of winners in weightlifting events of the DPRK Championships and the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize, several of them renewing national records.
					
					 The team has also world-known weightlifting aces, among them Rim Jong Sim, who took gold medals in the 30th Olympic Games and the 6th East Asian Games, and Ryo Un Hui, who won in the 2014 World Weightlifting Championships and the 2013 Asian Weightlifting Championships.

articles.title: Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition Held
articles.content:
Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition Held
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of children's science fictions and models was held here from June 5 to 8 in celebration of the 69th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union. 
					 The exhibition brought together at least 300 pupils from junior and senior secondary schools across the country. 
					
					 The participants presented more than 330 exhibits including science fictions, programs and models.

articles.title: Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools Closes
articles.content:
Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools Closes
						
 Mundok, June 8 (KCNA) -- The 52nd National Sports Contest of Juvenile Sports Schools closed with due ceremony at Mundok County Gymnasium in South Phyongan Province on Monday.
					 At the contest the players fully displayed the sports technique they cultivated in the course of preparing themselves as reliable pillars of Songun Korea.

articles.title: New Water Quality Multi-parameter Developed
articles.content:
New Water Quality Multi-parameter Developed 
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A new water quality multi-parameter was developed by a research group of Kim Chaek University of Technology in the DPRK.
					 The instrument makes it possible to monitor and control the major indices of water, including pH, temperature, oxidation-reduction potential and dissolved oxygen. The parameter has already been introduced in many fish farms and fishponds across the country.
					
					 Kim Kum Chol, a section chief of the university, said the research group has succeeded in manufacturing the parameter with homemade sensors.
					
					 When visiting a fish farm some time ago, supreme leader Kim Jong Un highly appreciated the group for its contribution to the modernization of the farm. 
					
					 The parameter is portable and weighs light. 
					
					 Now its utility has been proved in different fields, including foodstuff and smelting industries, sewage treatment and others.

articles.title: Scientific Achievements Made in Weather Forecast
articles.content:
Scientific Achievements Made in Weather Forecast
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The State Hydro-meteorological Administration of the DPRK has made successes in putting the weather forecast on a more scientific basis over the past one year.
					 In June last year, supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited the Administration and stressed the need for its researchers and forecasters to enhance their role and intensify the scientific researches for accurate weather information.
					
					 In hearty response to his instructions, the Administration concentrated efforts on improving the capability of forecasting downpour and rainstorm in summer and local meteorology.
					
					 It established new real-time flood prediction system for the River Taedong and new system of estimating the quantity of water in main rivers and reservoirs in dry season. 
					
					 The Administration also bettered marine forecast according to territorial areas.
					
					 Meanwhile, a work was conducted to put data communication between the Administration and provincial weather stations on an IT basis.
					
					 The Administration is now offering, through mobiles, real-time weather information and short- and middle-term forecast in main areas.
					
					 And it directs efforts to strengthening the technological exchange among scientists and forecasters through national and regional courses and experience-share meetings.
					
					 Choe Kwang Guk, director of the Central Weather Forecast Station, told KCNA that they would work harder to update the meteorological observation.

articles.title: Mirim Distemper Factory
articles.content:
Mirim Distemper Factory
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) ? An increasing number of building-materials factories has put production on a normal basis with locally available raw materials in the DPRK. Among them is the Mirim Distemper Factory, which produces 30 kinds of building materials with home-made equipment.
					 Song Tong Gi, manager of the factory, told KCNA that the products of the factory have gained popularity for their high quality.
					
					 He said:
					
					 In recent years alone, the products have been used in the construction of the People's Theatre, Mangyongdae Revolutionary School, the Ryugyong Dental Hospital and others.
					
					 The factory manufactured different machines for production by its own effort and has made great achievements in decisively increasing the proportion of locally available finishing materials.
					
					 The factory is also paying big efforts to further upgrading its products.

articles.title: New Pieces of Evidence Proving Crimes of U.S., Japanese Aggressors Discovered in DPRK
articles.content:
New Pieces of Evidence Proving Crimes of U.S., Japanese Aggressors Discovered in DPRK
						
Kaesong, June 7 (KCNA) -- New pieces of evidence disclosing the history of invasion and criminal acts perpetrated by the U.S. and Japanese imperialists are being discovered in Kaesong City and Jangphung County near the Military Demarcation Line.
					A lot of bombs, shells, mines, grenades and bullets of various kinds used by the U.S. imperialist aggressors during the past Korean war were discovered in Konam-ri, Kaesong City and Sasi-ri and Kuhwa-ri, Jangphung County during the land rezoning.
					
					Meanwhile, nearly one meter-long saber used by Samurais during their occupation of Korea was discovered in Pangjik-dong, Kaesong City. Its grasp is decorated with the pattern of cherry flower.
					
					The Kaesong City House of Class Education displayed photos disclosing the atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialist aggressors at a police station located in the area where the saber was discovered and other places.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Aborting Events for Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Aborting Events for Reunification 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the south Korean puppet Ministry of Unification recently said it was "very inappropriate for the north to shift the responsibility for aborting the events and the south expected successful promotion of the events." He went the lengths of making desperate efforts to pass the buck for scuttling the events to the north, grumbling about "the north's shunning the south's proposal for contacts and the north's refusal to hold the joint events."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are known to be old hands at telling lies and hatching plots but it is disgusting, indeed, for them to behave so shamelessly as to feign ignorance of what is very clear to the world. 
					
					 The DPRK made important proposals for opening up a wide avenue to independent reunification in the beginning of the year and has made unsparing efforts to realize them, the commentary says, revealing the fact that the south Korean puppet authorities have made open obstructions to bar the June 15 joint national events from taking place. 
					
					 No matter what wordplay the south Korean authorities stage, they can never evade the responsibility for having chilled the aspiration and enthusiasm of the nation for reunification and aborted the joint events. 
					
					 The present north-south relations, which are being pushed to ever more serious catastrophe after a good opportunity arranged with much effort for the June 15 joint national events was scuppered, once again clearly prove that distrust and confrontation between the north and the south will fester and they will lead to a war in the end if the south Korean authorities deny the June 15 joint declaration and take an ill-intended approach towards it.

articles.title: Japan's Settlement of Past Crimes Is Only Option for Its Future: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Settlement of Past Crimes Is Only Option for Its Future: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, at least 6 900 scholars of 16 organizations in Japan made public a joint statement demanding the government admit the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. They called for a stop to tampering with history, asserting that politicians and media persons' irresponsible attitude toward the sexual slavery shows the world that Japan doesn't respect the human rights.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday comments that this is a very just assertion.
					
					 Japan's past history is the one of crimes, a history of aggression and plunder which forced Asian people to shed so much blood, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 A guilty person should repent of his wrongdoing and apologize for it. It is ethics and morality, legal requirement and practice.
					
					 Prompted by them, Germany and other countries made apologies and reparation to the damaged countries, victims and bereaved families for their past wrongdoings.
					
					 However, Japan is the only country which has not yet admitted its past crimes for 70 years since its defeat, far from paying reparation.
					
					 What infuriates the world is Japan's attitude towards the sexual slavery.
					
					 Nowadays Japan is getting ever more undisguised in its moves to deny its past history including sexual slavery. Its chief executive is in the lead.
					
					 The aim sought by it is to repeat the bloody history by writing off its past crime-woven history and shunning reparation.
					
					 We would like to advise Japan once again that it will have no future unless it admits and makes apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 Japan's liquidation of the past history is the only option to head for future, trusted by the international community.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Anti-DPRK Provocative Rhetoric of New Commander of U.S. Forces in Pacific
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Anti-DPRK Provocative Rhetoric of New Commander of U.S. Forces in Pacific 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Harry Harris, commander of the U.S. forces in the Pacific, in his inaugural speech on May 27 named the DPRK the primary target when enumerating challenges to his command.
					 In an interview with a weekly news earlier he said north Korea is the biggest threat in the Asia-Pacific and that he gets up even in the evening because of north Korea.
					
					 The U.S. return to the Asia-Pacific strategy has entered the phase of full-scale implementation and the position and role of the U.S. forces in the Pacific have steadily increased.
					
					 His inauguration as the commander of the U.S. forces in the Pacific, a brass hat with a negative view on the DPRK, against this backdrop can not but reflect the U.S. policy towards it.
					
					 The U.S. forces command in the Pacific with approximately 50 percent of the world areas under its control has a key role to play in meeting the U.S. world strategic interests.
					
					 The main operational theatre of the U.S. world domination strategy at present is the Asia-Pacific, the Korean peninsula and its vicinity to be specific.
					
					 The U.S. persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK is prompted by its fear that it would never be able to hold hegemony in the Asia-Pacific nor would it be able to realize its ambition for world domination without stifling the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has, therefore, deliberately and systematically rendered the situation tense.
					
					 It has introduced into south Korea and its vicinity huge nuclear war means to stage north-targeted nuclear war drills and turn the Asia-Pacific including the Korean peninsula into a hotspot where constant tension lingers.
					
					 The appointment of the new commander of the U.S. forces in the Pacific and the clarification of his stand indicate that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK will get all the more vicious.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the army and people of the DPRK were quite just when they defended the sovereignty of the country, the lifeline of the nation, true to the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea, the line on simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is bound to go bust.
					
					 As long as the U.S. persists in its moves for war of aggression against the DPRK, being pursuant to its anachronistic hostile policy toward it, the latter will bolster up its nuclear deterrence for self-defence qualitatively and quantitatively under the uplifted banner of the above-said line.
					
					 The U.S. had increased the danger of a nuclear war to the maximum, compelling the DPRK to have access to nukes. It is because of this that the U.S. is seized with extreme uneasiness.
					
					 Moreover, the U.S. is much upset by the successful test of SLBM by the DPRK.
					
					 All the attempts of the U.S. to threaten the DPRK's sovereignty and vital rights and play down its capabilities for self-defence are bound to fail in the end.
					
					 The U.S. will never be able to have a sound sleep.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Condemns U.S. and Puppet Group for Threatening People's Life
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Condemns U.S. and Puppet Group for Threatening People's Life
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Taejon Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a press conference outside the Taejon City Office on June 2 at which it condemned the U.S. imperialists and the puppet forces for threatening the people's life.
					 Speakers demanded the U.S. president personally apologize to the south Koreans for introducing active anthrax germs into the U.S. military base and dismantle relevant facilities at once.
					
					 The organization in a press release urged the "government" to revise the shackling SOFA which made the U.S. forces' introduction of dangerous substance uncontrollable though it is harmful to the people's life and security.

articles.title: South Koreans Protest against U.S. Moves for Bio-chemical Warfare
articles.content:
South Koreans Protest against U.S. Moves for Bio-chemical Warfare
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea staged a protest against the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' moves for bio-chemical warfare in Seoul on June 5.
					 The organization accused the U.S. of using south Korea as a test ground for bio-chemical warfare by introducing anthrax germs in disregard of life and security of the south Korean people.
					
					 The introduction of anthrax germs  is a wanton violation of international law, the organization noted, disclosing that south Korea and U.S. authorities put forward a strategy for mounting a preemptive attack on the north not only with nuclear weapons but with bio-chemical weapons and have intensified joint military exercises.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Demands Probe into Truth about U.S. Introduction of Anthrax Germs
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Demands Probe into Truth about U.S. Introduction of Anthrax Germs
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "Experiment for germ warfare by U.S. forces present in south Korea more disastrous than MERS" was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on June 5.
					 The editorial said that the news of the U.S. introduction of botulinus germs 100 000 times more poisonous than anthrax germs into south Korea to conduct experiments is stunning public at a time when the spread of MERS is striking all people with horror.
					
					 It demanded the authorities push forward a prompt and total revision of the SOFA or its repeal, bring to light the truth about the introduction and take basic measures.

articles.title: Korean in China Slams S. Korean Authorities' Moves against DPRK
articles.content:
Korean in China Slams S. Korean Authorities' Moves against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Paek Kyong Hyon, chairperson of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, released an article on June 5 denouncing the south Korean authorities for denying the June 15 joint declaration, depending on foreign forces and resorting to the moves for escalating confrontation with the DPRK.
					 The door of north-south dialogue remains closed, brisk undertakings for cooperation were brought to naught and the danger of military conflict is increasing, the article said, adding it is attributable to the pro-U.S. conservative regime in south Korea which is totally denying the joint declaration and persistently pursuing only the policy for confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 If the Park Geun Hye group persistently denies the joint declaration while pursuing the policy for confrontation with the DPRK as henchmen of the U.S., the group will be bitterly cursed and condemned by all Koreans and meet a miserable end, the article warned.

articles.title: 20DPRK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 A reading session of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work and film show were held in Benin, a photo exhibition and film show in Nigeria and round-table talks in Ethiopia on May 29 and June 1.
					
					 Displayed at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos dealing with the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the efforts of the army and people of the DPRK for the building of a thriving nation and national reunification.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification".
					
					 The chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" who doubles as chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea read out Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party".

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Syria
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Syria
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A Syrian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed on June 3.
					 The director of the Higher Education Department of the Regional Leadership of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the revolutionary feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and organize meeting, round-table talks and other political and cultural events on these significant anniversaries.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK to Be Marked in DR Congo
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK to Be Marked in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the DR Congo for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Kinshasa on June 2.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of the DR Congo, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period till October 30 and discussed its action program for organizing a meeting, seminar, lecture and other political and cultural events and conducting the brisk movement for solidarity with the Korean people during the period.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in DR Congo
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in DR Congo
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people and a film show took place in Kinshasa on May 27 to mark the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the DR Congo, made a report to be followed by a speech of Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of the DR Congo.
					
					 The reporter said that the Korean people are suffering pain of national division for seven decades due to the U.S. obstructing Korea's reunification after occupying south Korea. He added:
					
					 The U.S. is blocking the reunification of Korea to realize its strategy for dominating Asia and pushing the regional situation to the extreme pitch of tension.
					
					 The DPRK is making every possible effort to reunify the country.
					
					 The way of improving the north-south relations and hastening the reunification is to respect and thoroughly implement the joint declaration.
					
					 A statement which was adopted at the meeting expressed full support for the joint declaration and called upon the world progressive people to fully support the just cause of the Korean people to reunify the country independently and peacefully.
					
					 A film exposing the true colors of the U.S. imperialists as the provocateurs of the Korean war was shown at the film show.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Observed by Media of Russia, Germany
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Observed by Media of Russia, Germany
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration was observed by media of Russia and Germany.
					 The Russian paper Bremya Peremon Plus TV said in an article titled "By Our Nation Itself" on May 26:
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, a landmark for Korea's reunification, was published in Pyongyang in June, 2000. The idea of By Our Nation Itself, the basic spirit of the joint declaration, serves as the banner of Korea's reunification.
					
					 This idea is the most reasonable and just one in light of both the reality of the Korean peninsula which has been divided due to foreign forces and the essence of the issue of Korea's reunification calling for re-linking the severed lineage of the nation.
					
					 Reflected in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself is the spirit of the great national unity. Peace and security on the Korean peninsula precisely mean peace and security of the world.
					
					 The eye-opening events that took place in the north-south relations after the publication of the joint declaration are the fruition of the idea of By Our Nation Itself. To defend and implement this idea is the only way of achieving reunification and prosperity of the Korean nation and the peace and stability in the region and the world lie in.
					
					 The validity of the joint declaration was introduced in an article posted on the website of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on May 28.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente ghanes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente ghanes
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 6 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica de Ghana, John Dramani Mahama, en relacion con que en Accra, capital de este pais africano, hubo una gran perdida humana por el incendio y la inundacion.
					El remitente expreso profunda simpatia y condolencias al destinatario, el gobierno y el pueblo de Ghana y las familias  de las victimas.
					
					Deseo que se lograren exitos en los esfuerzos del presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo de Ghana por eliminar lo mas pronto posible las consecuencias de las calamidades.

articles.title: Park Geun-hye debe actuar con prudencia, advierte portavoz de CRPP
articles.content:
Park Geun-hye debe actuar con prudencia, advierte portavoz de CRPP  
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- En su declaracion fechada 7, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) advirtio a Park Geun-hye que mantenga callada su boca sucia y preste atencion a la situacion miserable del sur de Corea, y continuo:
					En su discurso pronunciado el pasado dia 6 por el sexagesimo "Dia de Conmemoracion de los Caidos", la mandataria surcoreana acuso de "amenaza" las armas nucleares, el desarrollo de cohete de largo alcance y el lanzamiento de prueba de proyectil balistico del submarino estrategico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea demandandole la "renuncia de armas nucleares".
					
					Esto deviene una provocacion imperdonable contra la RPDC.
					
					La negacion a la linea del desarrollo paralelo y las medidas de fortalecimiento de las fuerzas autodefensivas de la RPDC es la negacion al sistema y el regimen e insulto a la dignidad y la soberania de esta.
					
					Con sus disparates difamantes, Park expuso otra vez su intencion malsana de confrontar hasta el fin con la RPDC y realizar su ambicion de "unificar mediante la absorcion", bajo el amparo de Estados Unidos.
					
					En estos dias, ella habla a menudo de la "reunificacion pacifica" y el "dialogo". Pero, si tiene interes alli, deberia reconocer y practicar la declaracion conjunta acordada y ejecutada por las autoridades de ambas partes coreanas.
					
					La declaracion conjunta del Norte y el Sur de Corea aclara el rumbo mas racional y los metodos imparciales para asegurar la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y realizar la reconciliacion, la unidad, la prosperidad comun y la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Aunque Park hable tanto de la "unificacion pacifica" y el "dialogo" negando a la declaracion conjunta e impidiendo su ejecucion, nadie le prestara oidos.
					
					La banda de Park no puede eludir la responsabilidad criminal por haber fracasado las relaciones intercoreanas y llevado la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana a la fase catastrofica obedeciendo a su amo norteamericano.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada polaca realizan trabajo de amistad
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada polaca realizan trabajo de amistad
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- El embajador, Krzysztof Ciebien y otros miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Polonia en Corea realizaron el dia 8 el trabajo de amistad en la Granja Cooperativa de Jangsuwon de amistad Corea-Polonia.
					Los huespedes desyerbaron en la huerta de hortalizas para ayudar a los granjeros que aceleran inminentes trabajos agricolas.
					
					Durante un momento de descanso, ellos presenciaron la funcion artistica de los ninos del jardin de infancia y departieron con los funcionarios de la granja.
					
					Y donaron los materiales agricolas a la granja.

articles.title: Pak Jong Ju obtiene 3 medallas de oro en campeonato mundial de levantamiento de pesas
articles.content:
Pak Jong Ju obtiene 3 medallas de oro en campeonato mundial de levantamiento de pesas
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- Pak Jong Ju de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea obtuvo 3 medallas de oro en el Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Levantamiento de Pesas 2015 que se efectua desde el dia 6 en Polonia.
					En esta cita deportiva participan mas de 230 jugadores de ambos sexos de mas de 40 paises y regiones inclusive la RPDC, Uzbekistan, Turquia y Tailandia.
					
					En la division de 62kg (m), Pak levanto 124kg en el arranque y 156kg, en envion, asi que ocupo el primer lugar respectivamente y en total con 280kg.
					
					Por otra parte, Ri Song Kum gano 3 medallas de bronce en la division de 48kg (f), en arranque, envion y total,  respectivamente.
